cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest on Tuesday then accelerate north-northeastward, crossing the Florida Gulf coast, moving inland across the Southeast U.S., and reaching the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Big Bend region

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas and Florida west coast Flamingo to Ochlockonee River (tropical-storm warning); Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay (storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, coastal Georgia and the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic shoreline, southern New England including New York and New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Low threat of tropical-storm-force winds (highest probability 5%) late Thursday night into Friday; gusts could reach 35–45 mph during closest passage.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for New York & New Jersey based on current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches, locally near 3 inches possible Friday; could cause ponding and minor urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions in New York Bight Friday could disrupt pilotage and cargo movements.
